that the origins of black face, were indeed oppressive and racist. However 
that was decades ago.
 
Let's look at the case brought up in this video. Julianne Hough wanted to 
pay homage to one of her favorite characters in a modern series. She didn't 
do it to ridicule, belittle, or otherwise make fun of the actress who 
portrays "Crazy Eyes" or any other black person. Let's compare that to the 
movie "White Chicks." The Wayans brothers dress up as blonde white women 
and portray them as dumb, arrogant, and belittled blonde white women in 
general. How can you look at these two examples and not realise which one 
is truly racist?

One cannot label all black face or white face as racist. It should be taken 
on a case by case basis. Racism will never die because of people like you 
who place the sins of our ancestors on us, and continue to bring up issues 
that passed centuries and decades ago.

captions.text:
• From celebrities secretly fathering children
with the housekeeper, to actors that blame

the world's problems on an entire race of
people in a drunken haze, we count 15 times

famous figures from TV, film and music have
walked into a PR blunder single-handedly

15 - John Travolta
• It wasn't too long ago that a masseur

filed a $2 million dollar lawsuit against
Travolta due to alleged homosexual assault

and battery
• It apparently took place in a massage

session at the Beverly Hills Hotel, and soon
afterwards another masseur stepped up to claim

the same thing happened, but then they dropped
their legal action and the case was dropped

• In the 90s Travolta was also accused of
something similar against an adult film producer

who claimed they'd shared a two year relationship
- once again though, they retracted their

story soon after
14 - Marilyn Monroe and JFK

• We all know JFK was a legendary womaniser,
with the facts only coming out following his

death, but far less discussed is the rumoured
relationship he shared with Marilyn

• The former president of the United States
invited her around early 1962 to his home

in Palm Springs with Lady Jackie conveniently
absent, with guests observing they were intimate,

flirtatious and spent the night together
• However, Marilyn's troubled childhood

filled with abandonment issues and sexual
abuse left her vulnerable, falling for JFK

who only saw her as a sex object
• She sank into alcohol and drug abuse,

her life over that same year with her death
ruled a likely suicide

13 - Pee-Wee Herman
• That old character from Pee-wee's Playhouse,

a children's show created by Paul Reubens
• Everything was going fine but then in

1991, he was caught greasing the monkey in
a porno theatre out in public

• He retired the character basically on
the spot, but has slowly brought it back over

the years until in 2002 when was caught with
nude teen photos in his home, which he claimed

were just vintage erotica
12 - Julianne Hough

• It was a joke that turned into a social
justice frenzy when Julianne showed up dressed

as Crazy Eyes from Orange Is The New Black
wearing the highly racist blackface

• It only took moments for photos to appear
on the internet and everyone went crazy, to

which she apologised numerous times, clearly
unaware about the backlash this kind of thing

always generates
• The actual actor who plays Crazy Eyes

even stepped up to say, it was just unfortunate,
but she apologised so let's move on please

11 - Brad Pitt, Jennifer Aniston and Angelina
Jolie

• Assuming you don't live under a rock,
you'll have likely seen the cover to any gossip

magazine with this love triangle printed on
the front

• Brad and Jennifer were married for seven
years before Angelina moved into the picture

during the filming of Mr and Mrs Smith
• Not one year after the divorce, Angelina

was pregnant with Brad's baby with several
more both adopted and Jolie's as time went

on
• Though Jennifer has her life back on track,

she makes it no secret she still loves Brad
Pitt

10 - Woody Allen
• Woody had been in a long relationship

with his girlfriend Mia Farrow when, in 1991,
this 56 year old filmmaker began a relationship

with their adopted stepdaughter, Soon-Yi,
who was only 19 at the time

• After finding raunchy photos of Soon-Yi
one year later, she left and the press and

public berated Woody for getting with a girl
almost a third of his age

• Despite this, Woody simply claims "the
heart wants what it wants" and after marrying

in 1997, they're still going strong to this
day with two adopted daughters

9 - Charlie Sheen
• This is a period during 2011 when it seemed

that Charlie was beginning to lose his mind
• He spoke directly to the media, claiming

he was a wizard with the veins of tiger blood,
even lashing out against the executive producer

of the tv show Two and a Half Men, calling
Chuck Lorre a piece of shit, troll and stupid

little man
• He was promptly removed from Two and a

Half Men and it took an entire year before
he stopped turning every media interview into

a PR trainwreck
8 - Michael Richard

• It was 2006 when this Seinfeld star took
to the stage in L.A for the Laugh Factory

as a stand-up act
• Unluckily some African-American hecklers

were making a ton of noise and interrupting
his performance, so Michael, already tense

and nervous about performing, snapped and
started yelling racial abuse at them

• Someone in the audience captured his rant
and posted it online, leading to huge media

backlash so much to the point that he quit
stand-up comedy and was forced to apologise

live on the David Letterman show
• He's never really recovered since

7 - Paula Deen
• A celebrity chef and cooking show host

who, in 2013, admitted to using the N-word
to describe African-Americans and that she

was thinking about using waiters dressed as
black slaves for a wedding

• She attempted to apologise on Youtube
but the damage was done - Food Network did

not renew her contract after 11 years
• Likewise QVC announced it was reviewing

their business relationship with Paula to
no longer use her name on cookware, books

and products
6 - Michael Jackson

• This man's life was filled with scandal,
a legend who defined pop music but ended up

having his reputation shattered following
child molestation charges

• The media found an easy target for the
singer who'd apparently bleached his skin,

disfigured his own nose and hung around with
children in his private home themepark

• In 2006 the official court case surrounding
Michael Jackson took place, but by then the

damage was well done, and he died not long
after with the stigma following his every

move
5 - Kristen Stewart and Robert Pattinson

• This was one of the most closely-watched
relationships in the media of two star actors

from the Twilight movie series
• Just like their characters, both actors

were happy together until Kristen Stewart
one day decided to sleep with a film director

from one of her movies
• After it was exposed, she went on record

publicly apologising to Robert - and so they
got back together

• Recently though, they split and started
seeing other people

• Smart move
4 - Tom Cruise

• This guy's always been a little crazy,
I mean, who could forget the time he went

crazy jumping on Oprah's couch like a madman?
• But in 2005 during some film promotion,

he criticised Brooke Shields for take antidepressants
for her depression, and scoffed at the idea

the ADD drug Ritalin helped people
• It got so bad that Paramount officially

ended their relationship with Tom's production
company, specifically pointing out his nonsensical

conduct
3 - Hugh Grant

• This is an example of how to recover from
a PR blunder using nothing but a little bit

of charm
• Hugh was caught partaking in lewd conduct

with a prostitute in a public place in Hollywood,
even though he was in a relationship

• Days after his arrest, he went on the
Tonight Show and basically just said, outright,

I did a bad thing - admitting he screwed up
and acting adult about it

• His career didn't slow down because of
this - in fact, some might say the publicity

helped him
2 - Mel Gibson

• Another wildcard near the level of Tom
Cruise, but it was a specific event in 2006

that would severely damage his career
• It's when he was arrested for drink driving,

and in his drunken haze apparently claimed
"Jews are responsible for all the wars in

the world"
• He was given probation and a year of AA

meetings, but his Holocaust-themed TV show
was promptly cancelled and he's been trying

to recover ever since
1 - Arnold Schwarzenegger

• The movie star and notorious Governor
of California who kept a clean public image

until 2011 when it was revealed he'd not only
cheated on his wife with the housekeeper,

but also fathered a child with her
• He claims it was the stupidest thing he'd

ever done - it ended his 25 year marriage
though
• But he'll be back
